name: Krogh's Restaurant and Brewpub

name: Krombacher Gruppe
description: The brewery was founded on 4 February 1803 by John Haas. His father, Johann Eberhard Haas chatted in Krombach an inn. As for a Regulation of 25 July 1618 serving of beer was only allowed if the restaurant also had its own brewery and a malt kiln, John Haas set up a brewery in the family business.     The water for the brewery ("Hasbrauerei") they picked first in barrels from a spring at the foot of the Grumbergs in the west of the village by bullock carts to brewery. 1854 had a brewery owner Haas church annual 17 Gulden (Florin) pay rent that the water pipeline was conducted on church land to the village.

name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
description: Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place.     The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.    The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight.     Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

name: Kulmbacher Brauerei AG
description: We, the Kulmbacher Brewery, oblige ourselves day-in, day-out to ensure that we live up to the expectations of Kulmbach, the quintessential beer town.    We both challenged ourselves to be and promise to genuine beer lovers that we will continue to make Kulmbach the secret capital of beer. We are beholden to the lovers of our beers. For them we mobilise our whole competence, knowledge and centuries-long tradition and experience of our brewmasters, in order to brew a first-class beer.

name: Kulshan Brewing Company
description: We are a new brewery on James street in Bellingham Washington. We have a lovely tap room you can come and visit, as well as a dart board and a nice sitting area. For us, it’s all about the beer. Come in and try some! Or you can visit one of the many establishments around town that are already carrying our brews.
hoursOfOperation: Sun - Thur: 11am to 10pm  Fri - Sat: 11am to Midnight

hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 3:00 am

name: La Barberie
description: Based in Quebec, microbrewery La Barberie since 1997 excels in the art of brewing premium beers to delight your taste buds!    Open daily from 12:00 to 1:00 AM, the tasting room (along the terrace in summer) offers regular rotation in a selection of eight beers varying the days and seasons. A small area set can accommodate groups of less than 25 people.    To your health!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am

name: La Brasserie à Vapeur
description: This Belgian farmhouse brewery is located in the middle of Pipaix, in the Wallonian Hainut region (15 km from Tournai, 74 km from Brussels). This family-owned brewery is named after the steam engines which power the brewing process. Their saison (seasonal) beers reflect the Wallonian brewing tradition, as there are many spices in the beers, although all their beers are spiced. They hold public brewing sessions from 9-12 noon, the last Saturday of each month.  Call ahead to reserve a spot; tours are in French and English. They serve a grand lunch buffet along with their beers in their brasserie across the street (30 € per person). Check the website or call for more information.   La Brasserie à Vapeur brews these beers: Saison de Pipaix (saison), Vapeur en Folie (lager), Vapeur Legere (lager), Vapeur Cochonne (amber-style).

name: La Cabra Brewing
description: Over the next few years, our headbrewer will develop both the business and brewing skills to establish a nanobrewery outside of Philadelphia. From Manayunk to West Chester, this swathe of land boasts some of the most well-informed, enthusiastic, and--frankly--fanatical beer fans. It would be our honor and pleasure to provide them fresh, small batch, artisanal beer with an emphasis on seasonality and occasionality.    La Cabra is a nanobrewery in the planning, a porfolio of beers over the last 7 years of homebrewing. Small-batch, labor intensive, and patient brewing produces ale and lager styles of distinct quality, integrity, and creativity.

name: La Cagole
description: Cagole the creeks is a girl; It is the brainchild of two childhood friends at a cocktail in a shed Sormiou.    Both nostalgic old Marseille and beer lovers, the cronies have devised a beer the color of the Old Port of Pagnol. A golden beer with a Provencal accent, that Caesar and Marius could have gone to the terrace of the Bar of the Navy.    This adventure is also a way to honor the elders that were the glorious Phoenix beers, brewed Velten and Marx in Marseille

name: La Cumbre Brewing Company
description: La Cumbre Brewing Co. is what happens when two people take one thing altogether way too seriously. Beer is what we do. It’s all we do.     The best beer money can make; the best beer money can buy. Simple as that.     Sure, we could tell you about the quality ingredients, the state of the art equipment, the commitment to traditional brewing methods… But all you really need to know is that our brewer is the pickiest SOB on earth, especially when it comes to the beer he drinks.     Well, this is the beer he drinks.     And we guarantee that you won’t find better beer anywhere.

description: ROSITA, the main brand, is a honey-colored ale, that delivers elegance with a certain density in the glass, ivory tones with white foam, creamy and consistent with a wholesome persistence. Due to the presence of secondary fermentation yeast, the appearance is cloudy.    We recommend tasting it cold, not frozen (42 to 46ºF) in order to envelop its aromatic presence.    Ones olfactory will detect fruit such as banana and red apple notes along with molasses which is very subtle but also very complex.

name: Ladyface Ale Companie
description: Ladyface Ale Companie was established in late 2009 along with its restaurant Ladyface Alehouse & Brasserie. Named LA Weekly’s 2013 Best Brewery in LA, and an international RateBeer.com Best Brewpub, Ladyface is known for their award-winning Belgian, French and American style ales.  La Blonde, La Grisette, Blind Ambition Abbey Ale, Trois Filles Tripel, and seasonal ales such as La Trappistine® Belgian Dark Ale, Bluebelly Barleywine and Dérailleur® Bière-de-Garde are brewed onsite. Ladyface is one of Los Angeles County’s first modern day microbreweries, and the first brewpub in the Conejo Valley. Visit www.ladyfaceale.com for more information on Ladyface beers, tours and special events.

name: Lafitte Brewing Co
description: Lafitte Brewing is a new start-up micro-brewery based in New Orleans. Named after the legendary pirate, Jean Lafitte, The Lafitte Brewing Company is regional brewery with an initial production capacity of 3,000 barrels annually. The brewery is to be located a 4,700 square foot facility in the Gentilly area of New Orleans, a community that understands the urgent need for new jobs and manufacturing facilities.

name: Lager Heads Brewing Company
description: Established in 2004, Lagerheads has continued to reign supreme in finger-licking BBQ anywhere around! All of are meats are hickory smoked, and the finest BBQ sauce you'll ever have! All of which are hand-made on premises. Come join us in enjoying are famous ribs and wings, which were voted Best of the Best 2010 compliments of the Medina Gazette!     New to 2010 is our brewery! Handcrafting lagers and ales, we have a taste to appease everyone. If you are really thirsty, we now offer growlers, 64oz of your favorite Lagerheads beer to take home, or to wherever the occasion brings you! We are brewing new beers often, so come in and enjoy us perfecting this art! (read less)

name: Lagunitas Brewing Company
description: From our earliest days of striving to make consistently good beer, and instead making beer that ranged from vile, to barely drinkable, to wonderful, to elegant, to questionable-at-best. From being castigated by our West Marin neighbors to finally suffering an 'eviction' by our West Marin septic system. From landing in the welcoming arms of Petaluma, and actually getting our beer into bottles, onto the streets, and into the hands of sympathatic beer geeks, to steadily losing less money each month. From all this and more, Lagunitas Brewing Company is emerging as a battle-tested brewery capable of making great beer out of goat's milk, brambles, and asphalt on the surface of the Moon, if need be.    As the poet once said, 'Where, but for the grace of God and the kindness of strangers, go I'. Where go we indeed, whatever that means.
hoursOfOperation: Wed thru Friday 3:00-9:00.  Sat & Sun: 1:00-7:00

name: Laht Neppur Brewing Company
description: We couldn't have said it better ourselves. Laht Neppur Brewing Co., located in Waitsburg, WA, offers premium handcrafted ale by the glass or pitcher in our tap room. Sampler trays are highly recommended for first time visitors. We also have Mason Jars, Growlers, and Party Pigs to go.    After home brewing for more than 20 years, Chiefton Brewer Court Ruppenthal, came to the Walla Walla Valley to learn the art of wine making. He quickly realized that what the valley really needed was beer - good beer. After all, winemakers in the valley are often heard saying, "It takes a lot of beer to make good wine." So he decided to open his own brewery, and opened the doors to the public on June 3, 2006.    All Laht Neppur beer is produced on site and is available in our tap room. There are no macro-brews here! Families are welcome, and we offer an outdoor seating area.

name: Lake Bluff Brewing Company
description: We're a quaint craft brewery in the Chicago's North Shore suburbs. We strive to create the finest beer while minding the rich traditions of brewing.

name: Lake Chelan Brewery
description: Lake Chelan Brewery is a nano-brewery located in downtown Manson, Washington that was created for the love of beer! We brew delicious and diverse beers and welcome the beer community and beyond.    At LCB, we currently produce 4 house beers-- Manson Beach Blonde, Mackinaw Red Amber, Devil's Backbone IPA and Imperial Prize Fighter Irish Stout. These tasty brews are created in-house, using only the finest ingredients and Lake Chelan’s glacier fed water.    Make Lake Chelan Brewery your vacation destination. Relax and sample some of our beers, or grab a snack and growler to bring with you on the boat!
hoursOfOperation: Opens daily at 10am

name: Lake Drum Brewing
description: Lake Drum Brewing is a small batch brewery operated by Victor Pultinas and Jenna LaVita in the heart of downtown Geneva, NY.

name: Lake Effect Brewing Company
description: Our name, Lake Effect, is inspired by the weather phenomenon we experience on the Great Lakes, most famous for creating legendary snow storms. The lake effect also produces longer growing seasons that yield some of the highest-quality grains, fruits and vegetables in the world. Most importantly, our central ingredient – the water – is from our great lake.

name: Lake Louie Brewing
description: Lake Louie Brewing started out as a mid-life crisis for owner Tom Porter.  He had spent 20+ years in the Engineering field and was looking to make a change in careers and a change in outlook.  Having been homebrewing for a couple of years, Tom wrote a ‘cartoon’ of a business plan that stated that a 3 barrel brewery could make a profit (in the first year, no less!).    Armed with said business plan and a cashed in 401k, Tom and his wife DeAnn proceeded to convert a metal storage shed on their property into a nascent brewery.    Lake Louie Brewing is located on 18.5 acres of land purchased from Tom’s uncle Louie Carpenter (hence the name ‘Lake Louie’) near the small town of Arena, Wisconsin (population: not too many, traffic lights: zero).  Lake Louie was the skinny dipping pond for area youth (including Tom in his day).    At the end of one full year’s brewing, Lake Louie has produced the astounding sum of 106 barrels of beer.  2001 year end totals:  276 barrels.  A 258% increase in one year (lookout Bud!).

name: Lake Norman Brewing Company
description: Lake Norman Brewing Company is a family owned and operated microbrewery located in Mooresville, NC. We specifically chose the name “Lake Norman” due to the Lake’s prominence and the vitality it represents to the population that thrives around it. Whether you love Lake Norman as your home or get-away, for the boating, the sunsets, the watersports, the swimming or the fishing, we are excited to be part of phenomenon known to the locals as   the “Lake Life”.
hoursOfOperation: Tuesdays and Thursdays 4 pm - 7 pm  Saturdays 2 pm - 8 pm

name: Lake of Bays Brewing Company
description: The Lake of Bays Brewing Company is Northern Ontario's newest craft brewery. We busted our butts for more than a year getting ready to launch, and now our retail store and brewery in Baysville is open for business (woohoo!). Try our beer and see what Pure Northern Taste is all about. Cheers!

name: Lake Placid Pub & Brewery
description: It began, like many microbreweries, with a homebrew kit and a love of beer. Not just a love of drinking beer but a real respect for the craft, the history, the art, and the industry, as well as a love for the brewing process itself. Today, Lake Placid Pub & Brewery has been brewing award-winning ales for 14 years and has expanded rapidly due to its popularity and quality, earning the respect of the brewing community.    In 1996, Christopher Ericson and a college friend purchased P.J. O'Neill's, a pub in the small, Adirondack village of Lake Placid. They renovated the upstairs into a pub and restaurant, installed a seven barrel brewery, and began brewing. Chris' brewing experience included Federal Jack's / Shipyard Brewing in Kennebunkport, ME and The Shed Restaurant and Brewery in Stowe, VT.  The Lake Placid Pub & Brewery soon became a popular spot both for locals and visitors to the Lake Placid area.

name: Lake Superior Brewing
description: A multi-award winning micro-brewery located in Duluth, MN.
hoursOfOperation: Growler sales, M-F, 8am-4pm

name: Lake Superior Brewing Company
description: Welcome to the Lake Superior Brewing Company, the place to be when you're in Grand Marais.  From our handcrafted beers to our delicious brewpub cuisine, we know you're going to want to come back again and again.  Nestled near the shore of Lake Superior we know that our unique atmosphere is unparalleled.  Steeped in the history of a harsh environment and life in Michigan's Upper Peninsula, the LSBC reflects bygone days while blending in its own contemporary identity.

name: Lakefront Brewery
description: Milwaukee’s own Lakefront Brewery Inc. started in 1987.  The industrious and inventive microbrewery located on the Milwaukee River has become a Milwaukee landmark.  Its rich history includes partnerships with local taverns, preservation of local historical pieces, unique tours, family style dining options and most importantly, great beer.
hoursOfOperation: See Website: http://www.lakefrontbrewery.com/details_details.html

name: Lakewood Brewing Co.
description: From our origins home brewing out of a garage in the east Dallas neighborhood of Lakewood, to quickly becoming one of the fastest growing craft breweries in North Texas, we stay true to our vision of local beer for local folks. We're dedicated to using the highest quality ingredients to produce internationally inspired and locally crafted beers.  Brewery tours are offered every Saturday from 12:00 Noon to 3:00pm. Schol!

name: Lancaster Brewing Company
description: We brew our beer in the heart of Lancaster County, Pennsylvania with great respect for the old traditions of brewing. Our master brewer, Christian Heim, has a strong commitment to quality and uses advanced brewing techniques to produce a consistent and high quality beer. Savor the hopped aromas as they come alive and accentuate the wholesome malt flavors in our ales and lagers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:30 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat:	11:30 am - 2:00 am  Sun:	11:30 am - 12:00 am

name: Lander Brewing Co
description: The beer brewing process began in Lander with the original Lander Brewing Company located just across the river from its present location. One hundred and ten years later, Lander Brewing Company is back, providing tasty locally brewed beer that we can call our own.     The award-winning Lander Brewing Company is located in the newly remodeled Cowfish Restaurant. The brewery won four national awards in its first year of operation, and has continued to win awards each year. Our Rock Chuck Rye has won gold medals in both the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Cup.     While sampling tasty brews in the stylish pub and inhaling the hoppy aroma of beer-brewing in progress, you can can enjoy tasty food from the Cowfish menu. In the summer our outdoor decks provide a beer garden like atmosphere under the shade of a hundred year old pine tree or this year’s crop of cascade hops. Looking for something more casual, order your beer next door at the historic Lander Bar while feasting on one of the Gannett Grill’s signature burgers or hand tossed New York style pizzas.    Our brewmaster Ted Briggs got his start at the Tun Tavern in Atlantic City, then moved west. Chris Erickson, former “brewmaster of the year” shared his knowledge and recipies with Ted and the results are amazing. If you spot Ted stirring his elixir in the copper tanks with his wooden paddle, checking his dials, ask him for a tour of the brewery. You will be sure to come away with a new appreciation for beverage with a thousand year history that gives this small town in Wyoming a world class taste.

name: Landmark Brewing Co
description: We are a small producer of craft beers located in the Central New York city of Syracuse. We currently brew two year round beers, Landmark Vanilla Bean Brown Ale and the Landmark India Pale Ale.

description: Good beer here!!

name: Langham Brewery
description: Langham is a traditional craft micro-brewery. We have a restored 10 barrel steam heated plant, updated with the latest control and measurement equipment to ensure consistent and flavoursome beers every brew.    What sets us apart?    First we only use the finest quality ingredients - water, floor malted barley and aroma hops, sourced as far as possible from local English suppliers.    And second, we cask conditions our beer. For every landlord this means a longer shelf life than beer from conditioning tanks. And for the real ale people it means better, fresher tasting beer.    Visitors are always welcome to the brewery shop for offsales - from two pints to a firkin for that special occasion, party or wedding. The brewery is open on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday, but please ring in advance to avoid disapointment.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 9:00 am - 5:30 pm  Thu: 9:00 am - 5:30 pm  Sat:	10:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: Lantern Brewing
description: Lantern Brewing is a very, very small brewery in the Greenwood-Phinney neighborhood of Seattle, Washington State, USA.    Our passion is beer, its enjoyment with food, and the history and culture that goes with it.    Our goal is to create beer that will enlighten the drinker; it will refresh and nourish, it will complement your food and bring to light new flavors, it will enliven the ambience and provide a delicious and memorable experience with each passing sip...    We will focus on highest-quality ingredients, sourced as locally as possible.  We will nurture the beer carefully through the brewing process, allowing it to change, mature, and to come into its prime; once it's ready, we'll make sure it finds its way to you!

name: LAO PEOPLE'S DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC
description: The Lao Brewery Company Ltd. (L.B.C.) is a producer of beer and bottled drinking water in Laos headquartered in Vientiane.  The company produces and markets 3 types of beer under the Beerlao brand (Beerlao Lager, Beerlao Light and Beerlao Dark), and locally-brewed Carlsberg lager. It also produces and markets bottled drinking water under the Tiger Head brand.  Lao Brewery Co Ltd was established in 1973 and is now a joint venture company owned by the Carlsberg Group and the Lao government.

Today, Laughing Dog brews has brewed over 15 distinct beers, including seasonals like our Huckleberry Ale and Winter Ale, and our award-winning IPA's and Stouts. But despite our success and growth, our motto remains the same as the day we started, to create... "Fetchingly Good Beer"!

description: Laughing Sun Brewing Company is all about freshly hand-crafted American ales. We feature live music and local art.  Our regular tap selections include Strawberry Wheat, Whippin' Post Pale Ale, Hammerhead Red ESB, Feast Like a Sultan IPA, Black Shox Porter, and Sinister Pear. We also have seasonal selections, and one-time tapping events throughout the year.

name: Laurelwood Brewing Company
description: Hi, my name is Mike De Kalb, and I’m the co-owner of Laurelwood Public House & Brewery in Portland, Oregon. My wife Cathy and I started Laurelwood in 2001 because we wanted a place where family and friends could meet in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. My restaurants are non-smoking and family-friendly.    And the beer? World class. Brewing Portland’s first certified organic beers, and a host of other tasty brews. We’ve received a number of awards including Champion Brewery at the 2004 World Beer Cup. Led by Brewmaster Vasilios Gletsos, our brewers create all our beers using only the finest ingredients. Stop by one of our three public houses and or one of our two Portland airport locations for a pint and a meal.   Make sure when you are out and about that you ask for Laurelwood beer at your favorite Oregon or Washington pub.

name: Lavery Brewing Company
description: Lavery Brewing Company was founded in 2009 by husband and wife Jason & Nicole Lavery. Jason Lynch joined the quest in 2010 to build our own 10 barrel production brewery. Born and raised around Erie, PA, we are all excited to bring something new and dynamic to the local beer culture - Brewing Innovative Ales in Small Batches!    By the way, it's pronounced 'Lav-ry' not 'Lave ry', a soft 'a' in the middle. Similar to 'have', not 'gave', thank you very much.

name: Lawson's Finest Liquids
description: Lawson’s Finest Liquids, LLC is based in Warren, Vermont and distributes small, custom batches of unique beer through their exclusive wholesale distributor, The Beer Guy, LLC. Sean Lawson, founder and brewer, has been an avid home brewer for nearly twenty years, with numerous award winning recipes. Lawson’s Finest, with a small batch system, can custom craft specialty beers for establishments and events. Limited in availability by design, these rare beers can only be found near the Mad River Valley of Vermont.

name: Lazy Hiker Brewing Co.
description: Lazy Hiker Brewing Co. is opening in Spring 2015 at the old Town Hall in Franklin, NC. The production brewery features a taproom on the corner of Porter and Main St. and a 15bbl brewhouse out back in the old 5-bay garage.    Come visit us in the Spring or follow us on Facebook, Twitter, & Instagram as we transform a great little spot in the mountains of North Carolina into a fully functioning brewery.

name: Lazy Magnolia Brewing Company
description: Founded in September of 2003, Lazy Magnolia is Mississippi's first brewery offering locally brewed beer to Mississippians and visitors to our state at all of their favorite restaurants. Located in the Bootleg capital of Mississippi, we break with tradition by offering legal brew to our customers!    Lazy Magnolia is dedicated to providing the best possible products through our tireless efforts, our superior motivation, and our Southern heritage. We offer our customers a line of refreshing beverages, made in true Southern Style, complementing the traditions of the South and remaining true to Southern tastes.
hoursOfOperation: Every Saturday at 10:30am. No reservation required.  After the tour, we'll give you a list of great local places to try our beer! No beer samples at the brewery. It's the law, in Mississippi anyway.

name: Lazy Monk Brewing
description: Lazy Monk Brewing LLC was created out of desire to serve local people with good quality beers. We specialize in brewing Bohemian and German Lagers but we do not shy away from British or American beers.    Craft Brewery that will be focusing on Bohemian and German beer styles but will not shy away from ales.

name: Le Brewery
description: Le Brewery is a family run business, founded by Steve Skews in 2001. We share a passion for beer which is crafted by hand using only the finest ingredients without any nasties in sight.    France is not a country noted for its beers, however, we've been on a mission to introduce good beer to Normandy. Le Brewery is located in the heart of cider country and produces British style real ale for the French market.    Our beer is brewed on a 10-barrel brew plant, with all natural top quality ingredients and live yeast for a superior taste. We produce a number of ‘house’ beers from the hoppy Norman Gold to our rich English milk stout, Odo.

name: Leamside Brewery
description: Leamside Brewery only source the finest possible ingredients for all of our beers. Our malt is provided by Thomas Fawcett and sons. Based in Castleford Fawcett’s have been producing traditional floor malted barley for over 200 years. Traditional Maris Otter pale ale malt is the mainstay of most of our recipes.    This is supplemented to varying degrees with a variety of speciality malts to enhance the flavour and colour characteristics of each brew. The hops are supplied by Charles Faram and Simply Hops. We use both leaf and pelleted hops from the UK, Europe, America and the New World. A careful blend is used to create the distinctive aroma and taste profiles of each recipe.

name: Leelanau Brewing
description: We do not pitch any wild yeasts into our alchemy. Our magic is performed the old fashioned way.    Each and every beer is hand-made in small batches, using age old techniques of open fermentation, barrel aging and bottle conditioning.

name: Left Coast Brewing
description: Left Coast Brewing Company was formed in 2004 with a capacity of 5,500 bbls.  Since then, we have expanded our operation to 13,000 bbls with our current tanks.  Our main focus for the Left Coast are Hoppy Beers, Stouts, and German Lagers. We do however add new styles as part of our seasonal program and have one Belgian tripel ale.    We brew, bottle and keg everything in house at our San Clemente facility and our team is dedicated to the perfection of our product.

name: Left Field Brewery
description: Know that feeling you get on opening day, after a walk-off home run or a suspenseful no-hitter? That’s exactly how we feel about beer.    We started Left Field Brewery under a simple philosophy: that great beer is about great taste and good times. We’re not here to confuse you with jargon or gimmicky promises - we’re here to make distinct, flavourful beers that can stand on taste alone. We’re brewing the kind of beer that we like to drink, inspired by the sport we love to play and watch; the kind of beer you can sit and enjoy during the game while talking shop over a blown call or a spectacular play.     Left Field Brewery aims to make beers you’ll remember. We’re free agent brewers who started out in the minors as a hobby home-brewery. We’re currently contract brewing with a game plan to build a microbrewery in Toronto to call home.

name: Left Hand Brewing Company
description: Left Hand Brewing Company has been brewing world class, award winning beers since its founding in 1993. They see their beers as a wonderful liquid food to complement meals and social occasions. They strive for the perfect balance and harmony between malt and hops in every beer, from a golden crisp Polestar Pilsner to a roasty, black Wake Up Dead Imperial Stout,  —allowing a truly unique and flavorful with every glass.

name: Lefty's Brewing Company
description: Lefty's Brewing Company is owned and operated by Bill “Lefty” Goldfarb in Bernardston, MA. This nano-brewery is a home brewer's dream come true. Bill, who has been a roofer by day and a home brewer by night for almost a decade, has finally decided to provide his popularly sought-after product to the public. He has traveled as far as Wisconsin to obtain equipment for his two barrel brewhouse. He is excited to finally put down the hammer and dedicate his full attention to commercially brewing his fine-tuned recipes. Bill, who firmly believes a local, family business offers the best service and product, is proud to have a family-run business operated by only him and his girlfriend. His product is hand-bottled and labeled. As of now, the beer is available in Franklin County, MA, with a wider distribution area in the future. Lefty creates high quality beers using only the finest quality ingredients available. He focuses on the simple pleasures of the traditional and time-tested European brewing techniques. Lefty looks forward to sharing 6 year-round beers, with seasonal and specialty batches offered throughout the year.

name: Legacy Brewing Company
description: Legacy Brewing Co. is committed to handcrafting unique, high quality beer by employing brewing techniques learned from European and American brewers. The complexity of flavors comes from a combination of high quality imported malts and our hopping methods which includes the use of whole flower hops. The Legacy team includes a creative collection of brewers, engineers, a microbiologist and our friends in the arts community; all with a passion for innovative products. Legacy...we brew pure pleasure!

description: Lengthwise Brewing Company was established in 1998 in order to follow the Great American Dream of turning passion into product. Initially, the creative partners divided their time between their "day jobs" and what is now regarded as Kern County's most popular micro-brewery. The production system includes a 14 Barrel Liquid Asset brewhouse and four 14 Barrel fermenters. Long hours and no pay almost never discouraged the inspired from taking a risk to pursue their heart's desire.    Childhood friends, Jeff Williams and Darin Schwicker, are transplants from California's Central Coast. Forged by a friendship of competitive swimming and unsuccessful fishing, the two vowed to create a brewed product "true" to their Lengthwise philosophy. Jeff's worldwide experience of designing and setting up breweries in such remote locations as the Caribbean, Ukraine, Russia and Japan certainly contributed to his vision for developing a brewery.

name: Lenny Boy Brewing Co.
description: Lenny Boy was founded in 2011 with an interest in a healthy lifestyle, a passion for fermentation and an obsession with brewing. The company started off producing non-alcoholic kombucha with one 7 bbl fermenting tank. In 2012, we stumbled upon our current facility in the historic SouthEnd district in Charlotte, NC. In January of 2013 Lenny Boy became the only Certified Organic kombucha producer in the Southeast! In September 2013, we took it a step further and became a licensed microbrewery.  In doing so, we became the only certified organic brewery North Carolina! The new license allowed us to diversify our product line, which now includes kombucha, wild ales, and traditional beers. We currently produce 100 bbl of kombucha every month and have a 7 bbl traditional beer brewing system. Our kombucha can be found from Virginia to Alabama and our beers are currently within North Carolina.  ENJOY!

name: Ste-Catherine
description: In a time in Northern France where trucks and commercial transportation were not yet a part of daily life, the process of brewing beer was a very different one than it is today. In small villages across Europe, it was the local brewer that filled the vessels of pubs and cafés with beer made from his own closely guarded recipes. With the advent of industrialization, however, local breweries all but disappeared, bringing to an end the era of the authentic microbrewery.    Twenty years ago, a family of brewers decided to revive the traditions of the past that were deeply rooted in three generations of their family – thus the name The 3 Brewers – “three” for three generations of brewing tradition. The 3 Brewers opened its very first microbrewery restaurant in Place de la Gare à Lille in 1986. Since then operations have expanded to 28 locations in France as well as several restaurants in other parts of the world including Quebec and soon Ontario.    Les 3 Brasseurs' success can be attributed to a unique concept: Fresh non-pasteurized beer made from the purest ingredients and from traditional recipes – all brewed right at the heart of each of our restaurants for patrons to see.

description: The Liberal Cup Public House and Brewery opened its doors in Hallowell in 2000. Whether it’s one of our standard 20oz pints or a heaping plate of Fish and Chips, we guarantee you won’t leave our pub thirsty or hungry. Throughout the year we produce 21 different ales and lagers, each one with a distinct character. We run the gamut from a Pilsner to a Cask-Conditioned Bitter to an Oatmeal Stout. You’ll have to drop in to see what’s on tap at any given time, because 115 Water Street is the only place in the world you’ll find our brews. We also offer a short list of regularly available food items during all hours of operation, and have special food items to be served during happy hour, weekends and special occasions.  Several local restaurants  deliver other fresh meals right to your table – just ask us for their carry-out menus.    The Upper Hall at the brewery can be reserved for private parties for up to 70 people.  It is a large area with separate restroom facilities, and a small service bar.  The Upper Hall has a sound and video system that can be used for business presentations, home movies, etc.  Inquire for details.

name: Lickinghole Creek Craft Brewery
description: Lickinghole Creek Craft Brewery is a water-conscious, biologically friendly farm brewery carefully crafting Belgium-style beers and growing hops, barley and other adjuncts. See our Farm Plan 2014 and read about the barley, hops, strawberries, pumpkins and the upcoming new additions of figs trees, blueberries, herbs, sunflowers, additional pumpkin terraced fields and a hardy orange tree grove.  Farmer Russell has ordered our new additions and will be breaking ground this February. We operate on a beautiful working farm in the heart of Virginia.    Lickinghole Creek is a water-conscious brewery.  We brew with well water drawn from the deep.  Our wastewater is purified on site and returned to the Lickinghole Creek watershed.    Our name pays homage to Little Lickinghole Creek, which runs through the farm’s rolling hills.  Since precolonial times the creek has been known as the Lickinghole where wildlife stopped to drink from the nourishing waters.  May the tradition continue.

It is our pleasure to supply you with what you need to help you slow down and enjoy life. Whether that is a Farm Girl Saison®, Crosscut Pale Ale™, an American Pale Ale or any of our other seasonal specialties, we want to brew it our way! We hope that through every bottle and tap pull, you can taste: the history of our City, the pride and fun we have in its creation, the uncompromising natural ingredients and brewing process utilized, and ultimately our sincere hope that we have given an experience that makes you proud to be a beer drinker.

name: Lightning Brewery
description: Our fine hand crafted European style beers have a distinctive Lightning Finish: a crisp, clean aroma, pronounced maltiness and a prolonged and slightly bittering finish. Our beers are good to drink on their own, and great with food. We have proven that you don’t need to travel to Europe to enjoy beers of these styles and of this caliber!    At Lightning we brew “Better Beer Through Science.” We believe that good beer can be the result of chance and that great beer is the result of an in-depth understanding of the beer making process. We take care to control each stage of the brewing cycle, never skimp on how long each step takes and only use the highest quality ingredients: malted barley, hops, yeast, plus a healthy dose of science.

That passion is evident in every dish and pint they serve.    It is in the spirit of the Morton brother's grandmother Lily A. Strange, a Scottish immigrant who brought to this country her love of family, sense of style, and appreciation of fine food that Lily's was created. The Morton brothers have recreated the feeling of their grandparent's home inside the walls of Lily's, tucked into Royal Oak 's vibrant downtown. name: Lion
description: Lion is a leading beverage and food company with a portfolio that includes many of Australia and New Zealand’s favourite brands. Lion was formed in October 2009 under the name ‘Lion Nathan National Foods’, when Kirin Holdings Company Limited completed its purchase of Lion Nathan and merged the business with National Foods – which it has owned since 2007. In 2011, we became known as Lion.     Today, Lion employs close to 7,500 people across Australia and New Zealand and boasts a portfolio of market-leading, household-name brands in beer, spirits, wine, milk, fresh dairy foods, juice, cheese and soy beverages. In addition to direct employment, we make a significant contribution to the Australian and New Zealand economies. We are one of the region’s largest purchasers of agricultural goods and an integral component of the retail, hospitality and tourism industries.

name: Lion Brewery Inc.
description: With a proud brewing heritage dating back to 1905, The Lion Brewery merges rustic architecture with state-of-the-art brewing technology, a contrast typified by the gleaming stainless steel aging tanks that sit alongside the traditional copper brew kettle. Our brewing process utilizes the traditional English method of upward infusion mashing in our combination mash lauter tun to create lagers and ales inspired by old world values, but with modern quality and consistency. The staff at The Lion Brewery is dedicated to producing true handcrafted beers, made right here in our century-old Brewhouse. All of our premium beers are made using only the four basic ingredients allowed by the Reinheitsgebot, or German purity law. Under the skillful supervision of our Master Brewer, Leo Orlandini, each of our lagers and ales are brewed in small batches using only the finest hops and malts available to guarantee the highest quality and freshness. Each product we brew is an original recipe especially created to deliver a fuller flavor than ordinary beers, yet with an approachable style and character. As a result, our beers have garnered numerous medals from the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Championships in recent years.    In 1974 the Lion Brewing Company bought the Stegmaier Brand.

The beers of Lockdown Brewing Co. are hand crafted with all natural ingredients without adjuncts such as cereal, rice or fillers. Our beers are superior because of the brewmaster's attention to detail, his complete love of brewing and the freshness of the beer.    The beers are named in the spirit of the history of Folsom, CA. Lockdown Brewing Co. exhibits the rich history of Folsom and the Folsom Prison through its identity and labeling.  Folsom was home to many firsts.  It was the home to the first Railroad in the West and the first city to transport electricity over the wire over several miles, 22 to be exact. The prison is California’s second oldest and has been made famous thru media like Johnny Cash’s “Folsom Prison Blues” and the movie "Walk the Line". name: Lost River Brewing Company
description: The Lost River Brewing Company is an artisan craft brewery and pub located in the West Virginia Potomac Highlands.    We are excited to open in this historic building, which is over a century old. Built in 1885, the first floor originally hosted a Frye Dry Goods store and blacksmith shop. Legend has it the second floor saw the first meetings of the local Masons. The Steinway piano prominently displayed in the pub was originally brought into the building in 1899. It has never left the building, and is the same piano that was used during the early 20th century to accompany silent films. During our extensive renovations of the building, we elected to preserve the original walls of the first floor, to honor the history of this building and the Frye Brothers themselves, the original builders.       We are grateful for the opportunity to establish our business in historic Wardensville and proud to become a part of the local community.     We hope that our artisan craft ales and delicious old-fashioned foods will add a little something special to the unique flavor of the beautiful Potomac Highlands.

name: Lucid Brewing
description: In July 2010, over a craft beer at a local restaurant, Eric Biermann and Jon Messier had a Lucid thought – “Let’s throw away the ties and the corporate ladders.  Let’s start a craft beer brewery!”  That Clarity in Thinking, led to the successful launch of Lucid Brewing.    In June of 2011, with a year of planning already completed, they realized jumping headfirst into the brewery was the only way they could make their dream a reality.  They quit their day jobs.      With that leap of faith – and a ton of support from many friends and family – they started building their brewery from the ground up.  Through the sweltering heat of the 2011 summer, many friends labored side by side with Jon and Eric.  They did it all, start to finish, from digging trenches to assembling the last tank.  So of course they needed a refreshing and light drink to quench their thirst while they toiled away.  They found just the right recipe and brewed their first beer – AIR.  A beer made to get the job done.  Its slight citrus aroma and flavor, lower ABV and crisp dry finish made this their favorite “go to” beer.      By October the brewery was complete and cooking.  And in the spirit of the season, Eric and Jon gave thanks to the Brew gods when they made their first deliveries to their first three customers the week of Thanksgiving… in Jon’s car.  Lucid was on its way!    Always keeping an eye on the demand for high quality while quickly catching the craft beer lover’s attention, Lucid assembled a team of dedicated employees and introduced brews to quench their customers’ demands.   AIR, DYNO, FOTO and DUO, along with seasonal and small-batch brews, are quickly becoming Minnesota favorites at local bars and restaurants.      Great success has followed them after throwing away the daily grind for the daily brew.

name: Lucky Town Brewing Company
description: Living in Mississippi, the selection of beer has always been limited compared to the rest of the country – but that does not stop those of us who seek out the diverse supply of the world’s greatest beers. Some drive across state lines to acquire the finer choices at festivals and suppliers alike, while others exchange trades with those from other states in search of the locally forbidden. But for those who truly take matters into their own hands, homebrewing beer becomes the purest form of gratification.    Driven by an extreme passion for both innovation and beer, our Brewmaster took what was once just a dream and decided to create a beer that would not only break state laws but also help change the very same laws that Mississippi has let fall behind. For eight years, he brewed beers of many different styles as a hobby - and with each tasting that he would hold at his home, the crowds grew larger. Eventually, he would be convinced that this beer should be available to those patrons who also appreciate the finer beers of the world.    Lucky Town Brewing Company was founded on this very notion – to craft beers that break boundaries between the working men and women of Mississippi and their wish for locally produced premium beer. This means that nothing is added to the beer except yeast, hops, water and grain. All of our Bavarian Style Beer contains malt and hops from Germany. Our Brew masters have extensively traveled Germany and the Czech Republic and have visited many breweries to learn the art of old world style brewing.

description: Situated in Southwestern Montana’s Gallatin Valley, Belgrade (home to Madison River Brewing Company) is an outdoorsman’s paradise.  Within an hour, one can be skiing or biking in the Bridger Mountains or Big Sky area, enjoying a hike in one of seven mountain ranges, or fishing world-class rivers.  The latter is where our name originated.     The Madison River has earned the reputation as one of the best places to fly-fish in the world.  Because the river is located in our backyard, current Brewmaster/President, Howard McMurry chose Madison River for the name of our world-class brewery.  Sticking with the theme, most MRBC beers carry the name of a fishing fly.    Madison River Brewing Company, Inc. started in 2004 when Howard purchased the brewery and equipment from Moab Brewing.  At that time, we contract-brewed for Moab, Park City, and Big Hole breweries. In 2005, Madison River Brewing Company emerged when we received a state license to brew our own brands.

The MadTree approach is simple – create high quality beer, educate the consumer, run a responsible business, and support the local communities.  MadTree engages local artists and craftspeople for their marketing materials, can designs, tap handles and furniture. Many of these efforts have received local and national recognition. name: Manayunk Brewery and Restaurant
description: During the 1800's and into the 20th century, Manayunk was known for the manufacture and sales of fine textiles. Krook's Mill, now the Manayunk Brewery and Restaurant, was one of the linchpins of the then booming industry. Anne Dawson opened the mill in 1822 at the mouth of the Manayunk Canal and the Krook family followed with the existing building just short of 100 years later in 1912. A cornerstone from the original mill was placed in the new building. Krook's Mill eventually closed its doors in 1992.    Four years later, Harry Renner IV brought the facility back to life as a space for retail business, a fine eatery, a brewery and as an entertainment complex for both neighbors and visitors alike to enjoy. Our first batch of fresh-brewed beer was tapped on October 17, 1996. In 2000, we expanded our outdoor seating with a deck overlooking the Schuylkill River. In 2003, we added a Stone Pizza Oven and a Sushi Bar to expand our menu selection. Today you can still find the scale, now an antique, that was once used to weigh the wool brought into the factory.

description: Starting life in 1984 as a company called “Brewtech” (very 80s) Matilda Bay Brewing Company was established by a group of local entrepreneurs all in their mid-twenties and all dissatisfied with the one-dimensional beer on offer in Australia.  They purchased a small pub called the Freemasons Hotel in Fremantle, Western Australia, installed a brewery and reopened as the Sail & Anchor Hotel. The brewery at the pub enabled the guys to control the quality and presentation of the beers and talk directly to the growing legions of converts.       Soon after this the rapidly expanding outfit acquired a property in Nedlands and opened as the Matilda Bay Brewery, producing its main brands Redback & Dogbolter as well as a raft of other specialty craft beers. At the same time the group had an expanding portfolio of hotels including the ‘Port Melbourne Brewing Co’ operating as the Redback Hotel in Flemington Road, North Melbourne.     In 1988 the Brewery again moved to bigger premises, an old renovated Ford factory in Stirling Highway, North Fremantle to continue to cater to the growing demand for Matilda Bay beers. In the early 90s Matilda Bay Brewing Company became a part of the CUB family – an arrangement that would see the beers reach truly national distribution.     In 2007 we relocated to the vibrant craft beer scene in Victoria, and continued brewing first in Dandenong and most recently at an old renovated Cadbury’s chocolate factory in Bertie St Port Melbourne, which includes a bar & restaurant – so we can again talk directly to our beer lovers.     Throughout the years we’ve produced some of Australia’s favourite specialty beers & ciders, and along the way bagged a swag of trophies and awards. Our highly regarded Head Brewer – Scott Vincent – leads our brewing team with pride as they continue on the mission established in 1984 at the Sail & Anchor Hotel.

Many beer lovers are familiar with our ales, such as Terminator Stout, Hammerhead, Ruby, Edgefield Wheat, Black Rabbit Porter, Sunflower IPA and others. Depuis janvier 2009, les opérations ont été transférées dans de nouvelles installations plus modernes et plus efficaces permettant d’augmenter la capacité de production afin de mieux répondre à la demande.    Les produits de la MicroBrasserie sont disponibles dans les meilleurs restaurants, auberges et épiceries de la région de Charlevoix, ainsi que dans certains points de vente à travers le Québec.

name: Microbrasserie Le BroueMont
description: Located in Bromont, the homebrewed welcomes you in a warm atmosphere of camaraderie. You can enjoy our delicious microbrews, brewed by master brewer and owner, Patrick Dunnigan. His wife and co-owner, Diane Moreau, serves one of these delicious daily or map, available seven days a week the homebrewed, is the place to stop through Bromont.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:30 am - 1:00 am

name: Microbrasserie Pit Caribou
description: Microbrasserie Pit Caribou is on a mission, since its inception 23 June 2007, to provide quality beers Gaspé leveraging its local resources. Having started small, the team now has a dozen employees and distributes its products in more than a thousand kilometers in the province.    Our beers brewed in Anse-à-Beaufils, a fishing harbor in the town of Perce, proudly bear names that refer to the Gaspé: The Blonde Anse, the Bonne Aventure Red, White 475 and Pratto Gaspé no.13. They are distributed to restaurants and even bartenders land of Gaspésie. You can also find their products in bottle 500 ml, 660ml or 1.9L our brewery shop and several grocery and convenience stores in Quebec.    The microbrewery is distinguished with several awards. The no.13 Gaspe won the silver medal in the Canadian competition "Canadian Brewing Awards" in the category in 2011 and bring the Pratto 475 Blanche was considered the second best white Quebec according to the magazine Protect yourself.      With the Star Series brewer, a dozen other products have been marketed since 2012, positioning the company among specialty beers. "American Brown Ale" won the bronze medal in the "New York international beer competition" in 2013.    With the expansion of facilities and purchase of the building, the company has the wind in the sails!

name: Middle Ages Brewing Company
description: Step back in time to when men were men, women were brewsters, and hand-crafted fine ale filled every flagon. Your quest for great taste leads you out of the past and into Middle Ages Brewing Company where we are sworn to uphold the tradition of brewing beer in small batches. Taste the difference hand-crafting makes.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 11:30am - 6:00pm  Sat: 11:30am - 5:00pm  Sun: 12:00pm 5:00pm

name: Middleton Brewing
description: Middleton Brewing is a small 1.5 barrel brew pub, located in south Everett.  It started as a hombrewers dream and through blood, sweat, and a lot of hard work and determination, was made a reality, by the Middleton family, in 2013.  Geoff Middleton, head brewer and owner, began creating his own ales in college and instantly fell in love with the brewing process and craft brew industry.  Middleton Brewing is family operated business, focusing community support, doing things right and supporting what we believe in.

name: Middleton Brewing
description: Middleton Brewing is a 10-barrel brewpub located in the heart of the Texas Hill Country. We specialize in Belgian, British, and American styles ales. We also do small batches of sours aged in Jack Daniels barrels as well as some "experimental" brews that we only serve in-house.

name: Midland Brewing Company
description: Midland Brewing Company is based out of Midland, Michigan. Our goal is to bring quality hand crafted beer to the greater Great Lakes Bay Region, through our on-site microbar, your local grocery store and through local restaurants and bars.

name: Midnight Brewery
description: Midnight Brewery is Metro Richmond’s newest micro brewery, located in Rockville, VA (just west of the city). We are extremely creative with our work and brew several limited edition beers. So stop in frequently; you never know what will be on tap.    We are family owned and operated; we answer to ourselves and ourselves alone. Craft brewing the best beers possible is our passion. We brew beers that we love, and we know you’ll love them as well. We’re proud to continue the great tradition of locally brewed Richmond beers. Be sure to come to the brewery, or stop in one of the stores or restaurants that serve Midnight. And check out our events page; you never know where we’ll pop up around town. You won’t be sorry.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Midnight Sun Brewing Company
description: Since firing up its brew kettle in 1995, Midnight Sun Brewing Company has become a serious yet creative force on the American brewing front. From concept to glass, Midnight Sun relies on an "art marries science" approach, mixing tradition with innovation, to design and craft bold, distinctive beers for Alaska...and beyond.    We at Midnight Sun find inspiration in the untamed spirit and rugged beauty of the Last Frontier and develop unique beers with equally appealing names and labels. But the company’s true focus remains in its dedication to producing consistently high-quality beers that provide exciting flavor and satisfying refreshment in all seasons.    From our extreme Pacific Northwest locale, we offer our wonderful beers on draft and in 22-ounce bottles throughout Alaska. Some of these beers are also distributed in Washington, Idaho, Oregon and California. We invite you to visit our hardworking brewery and retail Loft in South Anchorage every chance you get!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: Midtown Brewing Company
description: With our local roots, we take pride in our good relationships with local providers in the area.  Stop in for Locally Crafted Beers and more!

name: Migration Brewing Co
description: Migration Brewing caters to a diverse customer base who share a common love for quality beer drinking. In general our brew pub is geared to a creative and progressive crowd who enjoy a down-home drinking experience.

name: Mikes Hard Lemonade - Mark Anthony Group
Mikkeller
description: The story of Mikkeller is the story of two homebrewers that in a few years went from hobby brewing in the kitchen to national and international recognition.    Since the summer of 2007, Mikkel Borg Bjergsø, has run Mikkeller on his own. Mikkel is a gipsy-brewer, who brews at different breweries in Denmark, around Europe and the United States.

name: Mildura Brewing
description: Producing five permanent naturally brewed beers, along with unique seasonal brews, from inside the former Astor Theatre in Mildura's restaurant precinct, the Mildura Brewery creates beers that are inspired by & named after local produce, landmarks & themes.  The unique Mildura Brewery has held on to its former glory as the Astor Theatre with a grandiose refurbishment of the magnificent art deco building, but also includes a state-of-the-art brewery that is on full display to patrons drinking or enjoying a meal in the brewery Pub. Out the back is more fermentation area & a modern bottling line capable of packaging 3000 bottles per hour

name: Milepost 111 Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Milepost 111 Brewing Company. We have a nano-brewery (very small).  We are slowly integrating our beers onto Milepost's tap lines!  It is a gamble if you are going to show up and be able to try one of our brews!  We are certainly going to work on it so we can consistently have something on tap.     We also rent kegs and tap handles for your next function.  Please give us a call to reserve your next keg.

name: Milkhouse Brewery at Stillpoint Farm
description: Milkhouse Brewery at Stillpoint Farm is now open.  Visit us Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. We offer handcrafted farmhouse ales made in small batches from hops and grains grown on the farm.  Check our web page and face book page for hours.    Check back in the coming months for our grand opening!
hoursOfOperation: Fridays 3pm to 7pm  Sat/Sun 1pm to 6pm.

name: Milkman Brewing
description: Milkman Brewing is a collection of local home brewers that found each other and decided to combine forces to offer locally made artisan beer for Pittsburgh and the surrounding areas!    Our goal is to become a licensed boutique brewery so we can make specialty local beer for private and public events.    We love that Pittsburgh is a city full of thriving small businesses, fantastic local eateries, and beautiful art. It is our hope to someday be known as one of the things that makes our city unique and wonderful!

name: Mill City Brew Werks
description: Mill City Brew Werks is a small craft brewery and restaurant based in Camas Washington. As we are locally owned and operated it is our goal to support other businesses within Southwest Washington area and utilize local products and services to bring you what you are looking for, quality craft beer and great food!    We use only the finest hops and grains in every batch of Mill City Brew Werks beer and it is our goal to provide you, our family, friends, and neighbors, only the best tasting locally brewed beer. This we can promise not only because we are the owners of Mill City Brew Werks but more importantly because we love beer ourselves and are honored to produce it in the Great Northwest where beer is a time honored tradition and not a fad.    We thank you for your support and putting your faith — and taste buds — in our product.

name: Mill Street Brewery
description: At Mill Street Brewery, we brew with the finest ingredients in small batches, yielding lagers and ales of exceptional quality and taste…and that’s no easy feat! Our dedication to our craft and passion for pushing the envelope has earned us some serious accolades since we officially opened in December 2002.

name: Mill Whistle Brewing
description: Mill Whistle Brewing is a one barrel brewery focused on exceptional craft beers despite our lack of sophistication. Mill Whistle Brewing is on the site of the 100 year old Safrit Lumber Mill. While this mill closed in the 70s the lumber yard next door is a viable operation. We have obtained the lovely steam whistle that announced lunch time in Beaufort every day for 100 years. Therefore, the brewery is named after this whistle. The brewery will be returning to the noon day whistle tradition.

name: Millking It Productions
description: MillKing It Productions (a.k.a…MIP) was founded in 2010 with a singular mission: To strip down all pretensions and preconceived notions of the craft brewing industry and create a truly memorable and focused catalog of fine beers. MIP does not have a sampling room or bar. We brew a limited number of stylistically and historically accurate beers. We will not jump from marketing wave to wave. We will not brew unbalanced fad beers. We will never put fruit, vegetables or other gimmicks into our beer. Finally, all beers will be packaged in draft, cask and what we see as the most responsible and best individual container…Aluminum Cans.

name: Millstone Cellars
description: From Farm to Bottle; we source local raw honey, fruits and apples to handcraft intriguing ciders and meads.

name: Millstone Pizza Company & Brewery

name: Milly's Tavern
description: Milly's Tavern first opened its doors in January of 2002 at the location of the former Stark Mill Brewery. Milly's opened through the hard work and love of the craft of Master Brewer Peter Telge, a New Hampshire native, who has been brewing his own beers for the better part of 20 years. With the closing of the Stark Mill Brewery and the many changes that have befell the city in the recent years, Peter felt that Manchester, as New Hampshire's Queen City, was sadly falling the way of commercial and contract beers. He, with a dedicated following of fans of his brew, set to work reopening the brewery as "Milly's Tavern," proudly operating as Manchester's only brew pub. We welcome you as our guests to stop by and try a glass of Peter's hard work.

description: The Milwaukee Brewing Company is the 'grown up' brewery name for the familiar Milwaukee Ale House in Milwaukee's Historic 3rd Ward. name: Miner Brewing Company
description: Located in the heart of the Black Hills, and owned and operated by the same family behind the award-winning Prairie Berry Winery, Miner Brewing Company produces craft beers that are both traditional in nature, and yet truly “South Dakota”.    With five generations of family lineage handcrafting beverages in South Dakota, and with 15 years as winemaker and owner of Prairie Berry Winery, Brewmaster Sandi Vojta is inspired by the traditional brewing styles of her family’s European heritage. By infusing regional and seasonal ingredients into the recipes handed down to her, she has skillfully adapted those traditional styles to create craft beers with a regional character, setting each distinctly apart from other microbrews.    All of our beers are produced in small, 15-barrel fermenters, allowing us to keep each batch small enough to maintain microbrew quality and a close attention to detail at all times. The results are craft beers that are approachable and distinctive, to be enjoyed by craft beer novices and enthusiasts alike.    We invite you to experience Miner Brewing for yourself, as we open our Tap Room in Hill City this fall 2013. Stop on by for a flight or a glass, hang out to enjoy our seasonal selections, and stay a while for a little South Dakota hospitality.     Join us in the Black Hills and discover your own pint of gold.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Minhas Craft Brewery
description: Minhas Craft Brewery is the 10th largest brewery in America. Located in the quaint Swiss town of Monroe in the southern tip of Wisconsin, a town famous for having the most specialty cheesemakers in America, the very famous 'Cheesedays' and of course, world class beers. The brewery has been located downtown since 1845. The brewery consists of 300,000 sqaure feet of heritage and brand new buildings spread over 7 acres of land in the heartland of America. We make all types of beer, ales and lagers. This includes American and Canadian Lagers, Pale Ale, Red Ale, Amber Ale, Bock, Farmhouse Ale, Hefeweizen, Dark, Light, Lager, Ice, Malt Liquours up to 13% alcohol by volume, Classic Pilsner, Euro Pilsner. Oktoberfest, Winter Ale, Lime ansd many more styles of beer. These beers are made with 2 row and 6 row malts and are handcrafted in small batches. We actually have 20 million pints of beer (equivalent) at different stages of finish at all times at the brewery. We also make old fashioned Blumers root beer and sodas. Although not our primary business, we also do contract packaging for Dixie, Berghoff, Kum and Go, Crunk, Atomic and various other companies.

name: Brewpub
description: Brewpub featuring full flavored ales and lagers. In addition to brewery location we offer 2 offsite tap houses with full food menus (one also features 10 lanes of bowling). Company wide we offer house ales and lagers  with a rapidly rotating seasonal list.

name: Minocqua Brewing Company
description: Nestled in the heart of Northern Wisconsin’s lake country, the Minocqua Brewing Company is housed in an historic landmark building located on the island city’s north shore. Built in 1927 as a Masonic Temple, the building was transformed into a micro brewery and restaurant seventy years later. The brewery houses a seven and a half barrel system producing seven kinds of ales and lagers. The bar features a fine selection of wines, and cocktails, along with the skillfully crafted signature beer selections. The brewery's restaurant offers an interesting assortment of appetizers, sandwiches, soups, and salads with a gourmet twist.

name: Mispillion River Brewing
description: Mispillion River Brewing aims to be recognized by its customers and the brewing industry for producing the highest quality craft beer. We honor craft brewing by using the highest quality malted barley and the freshest hops and strive for the best customer service in the industry.
hoursOfOperation: Fri - Sat: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Mission Brewery
description: Originally located less than a mile from the very hill where Friar Junipero Serra and his scurvy-ridden crew drove their stake into the ground, Mission Brewery was born in those heady first days of the 20th century. And then prohibition shut it down. Re-established in 2007, we are honored to say that four months and four beers in, Mission was awarded two national medals at the Great American Beer Festival. Fast forward to 2010 our plunder of precious beer medals has gown considerably. Three Gold, three Silver and two Bronze medals now fill our bounty. A dream come true for long-time die-hard home brewers. From modest beginnings to a state of the art custom made brewery in the historic Wonderbread building just east of San Diego’s baseball stadium Petco Park. Our brewery should be brewing beer with in the month. Soon therafter our tasting bar will be open to the public. There’s nothing more enjoyable than a pint while watching the beer you’re drinking being made a few feet from where you’re sitting.  No catchy gimmicks. No national campaigns. Just great handcrafted beer made in San Diego!

name: Mississippi Brewing Company
description: Mississippi Brewing Company LLC plans be pouring beer in late 2013. What sets us apart from the rest is that we understand the need for local “Light Drinkable Beers” as well full flavored Craft beers.

name: Mito Brewhouse CA
description: Crafting beer in the mountains of the Caribbean.

name: Moa Brewing Company
description: Moa beer is the beer that comes from Marlborough, which is nice, because mostly Marlborough just makes wine, which is a bit boring. Moa uses the same deep bore water locals use to grow grapes and put out house fires.    Moa Beer is also made the way beer used to be made before everyone started making it differently.    So if somehow someone from 1950 travelled in time to go to the pub and had a Moa today they wouldn’t be surprised by its full bodied taste. This is because Moa beer is made by lots of people and not many machines as opposed to lots of machines and not many people. They would however, be surprised by the cost as Moa is quite expensive and they’d be used to only paying two and six. Whatever that is.

name: Moat Mountain Smokehouse and Brewing Company
description: Moat Mountain is a 174-seat brew pub, restaurant & inn located in one of North Conway’s historic buildings. Our award-winning ales and lagers are brewed on-site with fresh mountain water. Enjoy a pint with us or take some home in a growler or keg.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:30 am - 12:00 am

name: MobCraft Beer
description: MOBCRAFT IS THE WORLD’S FIRST COMPLETELY CROWDSOURCED BREWERY!    MobCraft Beer is a small craft brewery making custom craft beer. We produce small batch “custom craft beers” based off of users submitted recipes and ideas which end up in our recipe vault. Each month, you can vote on a wide variety of beer styles and flavors. Cast your vote by pre-ordering the beer you want us to brew. MobCraft will produce the beer with the most orders and ship out a 4 pack of 22oz “bomber” bottles to your doorstep! Or if you're near the brewery come pick it up in our tap room location in Madison, WI!

name: Moccasin Bend Brewing Company
description: Moccasin Bend Brewing Company is located in the historic St. Elmo district of Chattanooga, TN.  We’re at the foot of Lookout Mountain just steps away from the world-famous Incline Railway and very near to the great Moccasin Bend of the Tennessee River.     MBBC was started by two brewers whose quest for the perfect beer led them to learn the art of brewing.  Chris Hunt and Duncan Guy began their brewing education in the Barley Mob Brewers homebrewing club and continued to search for unique and distinctive ale and lager formulas. They decided to offer their creations to the public through a small batch microbrewery in 2006.  Soon thereafter, award-winning brewer Courtney Tyvand joined the two and presented his smoked porter at the brewery’s first beer dinner in October of 2006.    The brewery is located on the ground floor of a historic building at 4015 Tennessee Avenue in St. Elmo.  The building is constructed of foot-square cedar timbers and two-foot thick walls made of granite stone and mortar.  Built in 1911 as a packaging factory for K-Rations for WWI, we occasionally find artifacts from that era in the building walls and ceiling.  The brewery shares space with the Chattanooga U-Brew, a brew-on-premises business owned by Greg McCort.     MBBC is proud to offer small batch specialty ales and lagers in kegs of various sizes.  A tasting room is part of the brewery; samples of our beers can be tasted and tested on premises.  Occasionally we have tasting events or tapping events at the brewery or at a nearby bar or restaurant.  Please check our calendar for scheduled tasting events at the brewery.

name: Mockery Brewing Co.
description: Zach Rabun, formerly of Elk Mountain Brewing, plans to make a wide variety of beers, but they'll be grouped by whether or not they adhere to the fifteenth-century German beer purity law known as Reinheitsgebot; half of them will be, while the other half will be fruit beers and sours. Mockery will include a 2,500-square-foot brewery and taproom and a large biergarten with sixty to seventy seats, along with garden games.

name: Modern Monks Brewery
description: Modern Monks come from many different places. They share a deep, completely unearthly passion for characterful beer.

name: Modern Times Beer
description: Modern Times is a 30bbl production brewery and tasting room in the Point Loma neighborhood of San Diego. Modern Times is named after a beautifully crazy utopian community founded in 1850, and (almost) all of our beers are named after real utopian experiments or mythological utopias.    The brewery was founded by the guy writing this (Jacob McKean), a beer geek, former Stone Brewing Co. employee and long-time homebrewer, along with crack team of consultants consisting of illustrious graphic designers, vicious attorneys, a slightly unhinged kombucha-obsessed real estate agent, one faraway brewing prodigy, a pricey architect, a gregarious general contractor, and (a bit later in the process) three outstanding brewers.     Today, we're distributed throughout Southern California and have a fully awesome tasting room at our brewery, along with a super rad tasting room in North Park. You should totally come check it out.

name: Moffat Station
description: Overlooking an incredible wonderland of soaring mountains and magnificent pines, Moffat Station Restaurant and Brew Pub is truly a spectacular place to eat, drink and be merry. Moffat's fame has existed ever since explorers and settlers first came to exchange their animal pelts, gunpowder and maps for food and brew. Adorned with old west artifacts and memorabilia, the ambiance is inviting and inspiring—and so is the food. Join us to dine on buffalo meatloaf and other outstanding local dishes, and wash it all down with our authentic microbrews, lagers, stouts and ales.

name: Mogollon Brewing Company
description: Mogollon Brewing Company, LLC, and High Spirits Distillery is a small, 20 bbl micro brewery and distillery. Our beers and spirits are hand crafted from the finest ingredients available and we use pure mountain water.  The artwork found on our labels is the embodiment of, and is inspired by, Northern Arizona wildlife.  Mogollon Brewing takes its name from the Mogollon Plateau which sits at 7000 feet above sea level.   We are now located at 4366 Huntington Drive in Flagstaff, AZ.  This is a brand new 4500 square foot building designed and built specifically for brewing beer and distilling spirits.

name: Momentum Brewhouse
description: Momentum's goal is to provide you with a neighborhood brewhouse to call your own. Brian Hahn and his team will provide you with a comfortable tasting room and an interactive brewhouse experience. Momentum is for all ages and family friendly. As we get through the start-up stage, keep your eyes and ears open for exciting happenings.

name: Monadnock Brewing Company
description: Monadnock Brewing Company is a NH based nano-brewery in the planning stage. Please stay tuned for updates. We will brew high quality German lagers as well as American ales.

name: Monday Night Brewing
description: Monday Night Brewing is an Atlanta-based craft beer company. We currently offer two delicious styles of beer on draft in select Atlanta establishments.    Believe it or not, the idea for Monday Night Brewing grew out of a small Atlanta Bible study. We started brewing beer together on Monday nights as a way to get to know each other better. As we got more engrained in the industry and more people started showing up to brew with us, beer quickly became more than just a weeknight hobby.    We spent almost 5 years perfecting our Eye Patch Ale and Drafty Kilt Scotch Ale before bringing them to market. Years of minor tweaks, arguments over hop profiles, and experiments with different brands of base malts are poured into every glass that we brew.

Join us for one of our regularly scheduled brewery tours and enjoy a taste of a flavorful and genuine Maryland beer.

After hard work and determination, and several tasting parties, they are ready to launch Long Island's easternmost craft brewery.
